column4: hey I can hear only 1 program that is using sound ..if i use xmms i cant hear ubuntu sounds.. what to do ?
Configure everything to use esound - if you go into xmms, go to preferences and choose the esound or esd output plugin, things should be better
In what way?
If you go to desktop preferences/sound, is sound server startup enabled?
Hrm. It /ought/ to be started on login if that's checked.
it doesnt.. where to add programs to be started on reboot ?
You don't want to start it on reboot, because it's a session-specific application
I want to start "esd" on reboot
Really, you don't
The problem is that esd has to run as the user that's currently logged in
And you can't do that if it's started on reboot
Yeah, that's the easiest. But if you have start sound server selected and it doesn't start, you should file a bug
I want to run it as root
It won't work if it's run as root
It uses user-level authentication
it works ONLY if i run it on root
That's very, very odd. Please file a bug - that's not how it should behave
you se..
now ubuntu sounds work but gaim doesnt work with xmms on..
Uhm. It's possible gaim is doing the wrong thing.
Or just use synaptic, as God intended when he put it on the install CD :)
still doesnt work
